job_details.degree_required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

jd: Hello, Hope you are doing well, Please find the job description below; if you are interested, kindly let me know. Title: Java Lead Duration: Contract Location: Frisco TX , Atlanta GA (Remote) Client: UST Except OPT and H1T, All Work Authorization is Workable While sharing the resume, Please do mention the candidate location and Work Authorization. Job Description : Please look for lead developers with experience in AWS, Java microservices, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes , and analytics tools like Snowflake. Job Summary: We are looking for a skilled Lead Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AWS, Java microservices, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes , and analytics tools like Snowflake. You will lead development efforts, mentor junior developers, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions. Key Responsibilities: • Design, develop, and deploy scalable applications using Java and PostgreSQL on AWS. • Lead architecture discussions and drive best practices for cloud-based solutions. • Implement and manage Kubernetes (K8) for container orchestration and deployment. • Utilize analytics tools like Snowflake to drive data-driven decision-making. • Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to define project requirements and timelines. • Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration. • Conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices. • Troubleshoot and optimize application performance and reliability. Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. • years of experience in software development, with a focus on leading teams. • Strong proficiency in AWS services and cloud architecture. • Extensive experience with Java and PostgreSQL. • Familiarity with Kubernetes (K8) for managing containerized applications. • Experience with analytics platforms such as Snowflake. • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
